title: Can Riot please stop punishing the victim?
body:
It's becoming so obvious that victims of bullying in this game and being punished and the instigators get away with no punishment
If you guys actually read the chat logs, you'd see that majority of the time someone is being bullied to breaking point, and yet you then punish the victim for lashing back.

You guys have psychologists, you should know better

replies.body:
I can understand why you're frustrated, but Riot cannot excuse bad behavior because _"they started it"_, _"I was triggered"_ or _"they attacked me"_. 

Lets get something clear. **_Verbal abuse of any kind, from a victim or culprit, is not acceptable in League._** The rules apply to everyone.

If you ever find any conversation in-game is beginning to get under your skin, please use these:

1. **The Mute button.**

 As soon as a conversation starts to become toxic, negative or unproductive, I suggest you mute them. If you choose not to, and begin a flame war with the other person, how can you not be to partly blame?

 Like I said before the rules apply to everyone, you're not excused from punishment because he was attacking you. The fact is, by flaming back you've done the same thing he did, and should get the same punishment.

2. **Report**

 People seem to believe they don't work. Chat related reports are actually extremely accurate and effective.

 If someone is clearly toxic, they will be punished. It doesn't matter if they use offensive language or passive-aggressive speech, the system will pick up on it. 

 It will not though, identify that you were the victim and excuse you from verbal abuse offenses.

3. **Don't flame back.**

  There is no reason to respond to anyone who is toxic. It will never lead to a productive conclusion, it will never lead to an understanding and it will never lead to an end where someone wins.

 If you choose not to mute that's your choice, but just make sure you don't feed the fire. Concentrate on winning, not chat.

4. **De-escalate.**
 
 If someone does flame at you and you feel like helping them out. Respond in a respectful way that disarms the the situation.

 Usually blaming Riot is great for this ;)

 _"who the fuck fed lee sin, u guys are all shit"_

 _"we all messed up, it's just riot balance is terrible, no champion should have that much damage and mobility lol :D"_

I hope this helps just a little bit.

If you want more information on Riot's report system or behavioral research, I'd suggest checking out these 2 talks, [here](http://gdcvault.com/play/1017940/The-Science-Behind-Shaping-Player) and [here](http://www.gdcvault.com/play/1022160/More-Science-Behind-Shaping-Player). They go over what Riot's PhD psychologists think and act, when given common player behavior issues.

You could also ask Riot Lyte any questions directly [here](https://ask.fm/RiotLyte).

I think the issue is more that the instigator is also verbally abusing but receives no punishment.

If it sounds retarded thats because it is, but that doesn't mean it doesn't happen.

Id name and shame a few people who i know get away with this crap but thatd break tos.

And id get banned for trying to deliver justice to the people who actually need to get banned.

I understand your concern here. If this is happening consistently, then maybe it should be looked into.

But how to you know the other person doesn't receive punishment as well? Keep in mind, punishment could vary from chat restrictions to permanent bans.

Like i said i have maybe 10-15 people i could name and shame right here right now if it wasnt a ToS problem.

All of those people troll, and instigate fights yet they havnt been banned despite doing it for almost 2 years now.


And considering you only get like 2 chat restrictions before you get banned id say they are either not getting punished or they somehow keep recreating the same account under the same name.

And my money is on them not getting punished.
Have you been to Riot support with this?
Ofc, i report them on the daily.

Yep, the people that are getting punished are realistically doing the wrong thing. There's no doubt about that. But the issue is there is someone instigating this reaction, that is not getting punished like you said
So basically what you're saying is the bad guys always win. School yard mentality. See how far you get in life with that attitude

The bad guy never wins. What happens is by flaming at the other guy, you become just as bad as him.

Think about it this way, if someone assaults, you what do you do? Go to the police right?
Say you didn't do this, and went to his house with a baseball bat, and taught him a lesson. What would happen?

Well, both you and the other guy are now up for assault charges. Same in life, same in League.

Comparing Riot's authority to that of the Police is almost cringe worthy. Not to mention going to the "Riot Police" actually has negative impact. Toxicity wise I used to be way worse and I never ONCE received anything worse than a chat restriction. No queue bans or anything. Majority of these guys do not receive punishment.

I'm arguing that if a player has been bullying someone, the victim should have some leniency. I got my chat logs back this morning and all 3 examples had me requesting to report the abusers/bullies. No one ever reports those guys, everyone is out of post game lobby instantly. So you're 100% wrong, the bad guy wins 99% of the time, whilst the victim gets punished.

Hell I'm not even negative when someone on my team is having a poor game because I don't want to ruin my chances of winning.

> Toxicity wise I used to be way worse and I never ONCE received anything worse than a chat restriction.

+ The improved system we have now is fairly recent and came into effect around 9 months ago. If you were toxic before then, it's likely you were not banned.

 Lets be clear here though. The new chat based report system is almost flawless. No one is getting away with reportable offenses. If someone is not banned, you either didn't report them or it wasn't serious enough.

> Majority of these guys do not receive punishment.
 
+ Why do you think this? You were clearly banned, so the system is working to some extent.  

 Do you think the automatic system discriminates against victims? Well, it doesn't.
 
 The truth is, if you were banned but the _"culprit"_ was not. It's likely your behavior was actually toxic and his was not that bad at all.

> I'm arguing that if a player has been bullying someone, the victim should have some leniency. 

+ If there was no mute button, this would be valid. But there is a mute button, so why didn't the _"victim"_ mute? Does he like being the victim?

 You don't need to answer back to anyone, this isn't a verbal form of self defense. _**Mute and move on.**_

> No one ever reports those guys, everyone is out of post game lobby instantly.

+ One report is enough for punishment. You don't need the whole team reporting one person. If you report someone for offensive language and the evidence is there, he will be banned or punished.

I urge to keep an open mind and consider that if you are getting banned, but the other party isn't, it may be the case that you are actually the problem.
not hard to mute somebody nobody is physicly in your face forcing you to listen to them
if you mute trolls they will report you for not working as a team silly : >

I couldnt agree more Crepe!!!! OMG!!

Riot need to get their stuff tougher with this. I do agree.
I rekon they would give punishment to the bully, but also equally to the victim.
